Load the `clc` package R library (named this because R package names cannot start with numers). 

TODO: work in progress.


```{r}
library(clc)
library(readr)
```

Get a list of file IDs from the 100LC data.

```{r}
file_ids <- clc::get_file_ids()
```

Loop through the file IDs, generate word frequency counts per file, write the output to disk.

```{r}
# df <- clc::get_word_counts(file_ids[1])
# readr::write_csv(df, paste0('csv/', file_ids[1], '_freq.csv'))
```

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
lapply(file_ids, function(i){
  df <- clc::get_word_counts(file_ids[i])
  readr::write_csv(df, paste0('csv/', file_ids[i], '_freq.csv'))
})
```

Here's an example of the output.

```{r}
library(knitr)
df %>% head(n=50) %>% kable()
```
